item.title: Sarah add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "It looks too new and pristine ever to have been read by anyone else, but it has been: it keeps falling open at the most delightful places as the ghost of its former owner points me to things I've never read before." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A library is like an island in the middle of a vast sea of ignorance, particularly if the library is very tall and the surrounding area has been flooded." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ransom Riggs
item.description: "She moved to pinch me again but I blocked her hand. I'm no expert on girls, but when one tries to pinch you four times, I'm pretty sure that's flirting." -- Ransom Riggs

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A. A. Milne
item.description: "It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words like "What about lunch?" -- A. A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "When you see someone putting on his Big Boots, you can be pretty sure that an Adventure is going to happen." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "It's not much of a tail, but I'm sort of attached to it." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description:
"I don’t feel very much like Pooh today," said Pooh.
"There there," said Piglet. "I’ll bring you tea and honey until you do." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "We'll be Friends Forever, won't we, Pooh?' asked Piglet. Even longer,' Pooh answered." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I never know," Harry called to Hagrid over the noise of the cart, "What's the difference between a stalagmite and a stalactite?" "Stalagmite's got an 'm' in it," said Hagrid." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Harry — I think I've just understood something! I've got to go to the library!” And she sprinted away, up the stairs. “<i>What</i> does she understand?” said Harry distractedly, still looking around, trying to tell where the voice had come from. “Loads more than I do,” said Ron, shaking his head. “But why’s she got to go to the library?” “Because that’s what Hermione does,” said Ron, shrugging. “When in doubt, go to the library." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "What’s comin’ will come, an’ we’ll meet it when it does." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Chris Pavone
item.description: "On the semi-frozen river below, a duck quacked insistently, sounding like a grumpy old man agruing with a cashier." -- Chris Pavone

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "He wished that college required you to use your body more, forced you to remember that life was lived in four dimensions." -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "And then - thwack! - Anne had brought her slate down on Gilbert's head and cracked it - slate not head - clear across." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "While my friends struggled and calculated, I reached a solution by a set of floating steps that were partly visual, partly just a feeling for what was right. It was hard to explain how I knew what I knew." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bee Ridgway
item.description: "I am not interested in your fine calibrations of empathy or your great mission to protect the river of history. I just to live my own life, and I want to spend it having my own private fucked-up little emotions." -- Bee Ridgway

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Maria Semple
item.description: "That's right,' she told the girls. 'You are bored. And I'm going to let you in on a little secret about life. You think it's boring now? Well, it only gets more boring. The sooner you learn it's on you to make life interesting, the better off you'll be." -- Maria Semple

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ally Carter
item.description: "Your test had cheese meteor questions?" - Bex to Liz." -- Ally Carter

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Alethea Kontis
item.description: "Quit dwelling on other people's stories and make up some of your own." -- Alethea Kontis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Alethea Kontis
item.description: "It was a melancholy day indeed when the sister of solitude was Sunday's silver lining." -- Alethea Kontis
